pages.title: Fish
pages.text: There's more fish to find than I thought. The most common types I've found so far are the cods, salmons, pikes, perches, and lionfish.$(br2)Different bodies of water seem to yield different types of fish, I might try fishing in a cave next.
Today I caught a koi fish, but I didn't have the heart to kill it. It makes me feel... $(l)serene$(). Even at night, I forget monsters exist.

pages.title: Squids!
pages.text: Fishing is pretty easy! I've even started fishing up whole squids! This way I can salvage their tentacles with a $(l:cooking/prepping)cutting board$(/l).

pages.title: Glow Squids
pages.text: I should be careful with this one. It nearly drowned me! It caught my attention and for some reason I couldn't look away. If you get past its hypnotizing effect, this variant proves more useful!
Okay. I'm bored, but I still need the fish for my delectable seafood. This trap should catch something from the ocean floor once in a while.

pages.title: The Tastes of Fish
pages.text: Adding bait to the fish trap has yielded actual results. What I didn't expect is that different kinds of bait attract different kinds of fish!$(br2)Bread is a pretty good all-rounder, but I've found that different fish have preferances for beetroot, sweet berries, melon slices, and golden carrots.

pages.title: The Cutest Helper
pages.text: I've been catching clams and little guy opens them for me!

pages.title: So many pearls!
pages.text: I'm in love with the otter! We've gathered so many pearls I made a necklace. I might be crazy, but I feel faster and more safe in water when I wear it.

pages.title: Abominocean
pages.text: GODS SAVE ME. This thing almost tore me to shreds! DO NOT FISH IN DARK WATERS.

pages.title: Deadly and Useful!
pages.text: Some of the sharkthing's teeth came loose in its chase. Turns out it's a really durable material! Sturdy enough to build with, honestly. Most importantly, it gives me a chance to give these $(k)assholes$() a taste of their own medicine.
